title: Implement session management backend
description:
Build backend logic for creating and managing coding sessions.

Files to create/modify:
- src/server/session-manager.ts - Session creation, storage, and retrieval
- src/server/types.ts - TypeScript interfaces for Session, Student, etc.

Implementation steps:
1. Define Session interface (id, joinCode, problemText, connectedStudents)
2. Create in-memory session store (Map)
3. Implement createSession() - generates unique join code
4. Implement getSession(joinCode) - retrieves session
5. Implement addStudent(sessionId, studentId, name)
6. Implement removeStudent(sessionId, studentId)
7. Add session expiry/cleanup logic (optional for Phase 1)

Example session object:
{
  id: uuid,
  joinCode: "ABC123",
  problemText: "Write a function...",
  connectedStudents: [{id, name, code}]
}

Note: No database persistence needed for Phase 1 (in-memory only)
close_reason: Session management backend complete with in-memory storage, join code generation, and student management

title: Build Python code execution engine
description:
Server-side Python code execution with output capture and safety constraints.

Files to create:
- src/server/code-executor.ts - Main execution logic
- src/server/sandbox.ts - Safety/timeout handling

Implementation steps:
1. Create executeCode(code: string) function
2. Use child_process.spawn() to run python3
3. Capture stdout and stderr streams
4. Implement timeout mechanism (5-10 seconds)
5. Return result object: { success, output, error, executionTime }
6. Handle syntax errors gracefully
7. Kill process on timeout

Example usage:
const result = await executeCode('print("Hello")');
// Returns: { success: true, output: "Hello\n", error: "", executionTime: 45 }

Safety considerations for Phase 1:
- Timeout to prevent infinite loops
- Capture and sanitize error messages
- No filesystem access restrictions yet (future phase)
- No package installation (standard library only)

Note: Advanced sandboxing deferred to later phase
close_reason: Python code execution engine implemented with timeout handling, output capture, and error sanitization

title: Implement WebSocket communication layer
description:
Real-time bidirectional communication between instructor, students, and server.

Files to create/modify:
- src/server/websocket-handler.ts - WebSocket server and message routing
- src/server/message-types.ts - TypeScript types for all messages

Message types to implement:
1. Student → Server: JOIN_SESSION, CODE_UPDATE, EXECUTE_CODE
2. Server → Student: SESSION_JOINED, EXECUTION_RESULT, PROBLEM_UPDATE
3. Instructor → Server: CREATE_SESSION, UPDATE_PROBLEM, REQUEST_STUDENT_CODE
4. Server → Instructor: SESSION_CREATED, STUDENT_LIST_UPDATE, STUDENT_CODE

Implementation steps:
1. Create WebSocket server on Express
2. Define message type enums and interfaces
3. Implement connection handler (store ws connections by sessionId + role)
4. Implement message router (dispatch based on message type)
5. Add broadcast helper functions (broadcastToSession, sendToInstructor)
6. Handle disconnections (remove from session, notify others)
7. Add heartbeat/ping-pong for connection health

Example message:
{
  type: 'CODE_UPDATE',
  sessionId: 'abc123',
  studentId: 'student-xyz',
  code: 'print("Hello")'
}
close_reason: WebSocket communication layer implemented with message routing, session management, and heartbeat
